title: Matchbox Riso
description: Une esthétique nostalgique imitant les étiquettes d'allumettes du milieu du siècle et l'impression Risograph grossière. Caractérisée par une palette duotone strictement limitée, des textures bruyantes et pointillées, et des formes définies par un espace négatif soustractif sur un fond de papier fibreux.
description_en: A nostalgic aesthetic mimicking mid-century matchbox labels and coarse Risograph printing. Characterized by a strictly limited duotone palette, heavy stippled noise textures, and forms defined by subtractive negative space carving against a fibrous paper background.
description_fr: Une esthétique nostalgique imitant les étiquettes d'allumettes du milieu du siècle et l'impression Risograph grossière. Caractérisée par une palette duotone strictement limitée, des textures bruyantes et pointillées, et des formes définies par un espace négatif soustractif sur un fond de papier fibreux.
prompt: Vintage matchbox label illustration style, mid-century commercial woodblock print aesthetic, Risograph duotone technique, the {{subject}} is rendered as a bold graphic form filling the frame, heavy ink saturation with visible paper grain texture showing through, rendering is flat and iconographic with no gradients or smooth shading, depth is achieved purely through coarse stippling and density of ink dots, the {{subject}} is depicted primarily in blocks of {{primary_color}} ink where internal details like facial features and clothing folds are carved out in negative space revealing the underlying paper tone, secondary elements and environmental details are printed in {{accent_color}} ink creating a vibrating visual contrast, the composition is dense and full-bleed with the textural grit extending to all four corners, lighting is non-directional and purely graphic with highlights represented by total absence of ink, shadows are solid blocks of {{primary_color}}, texture is tactile and rough resembling uncoated cardstock or pulp paper, edges are slightly irregular and organic mimicking ink bleed and stamp pressure variations, the visual language borrows from 1950s folk ephemera and cheap offset lithography, atmospheric perspective is flattened into two distinct color layers, strict color separation with no blending between {{primary_color}} and {{accent_color}}, high-contrast graphic impact, {{mood}}, distinct retro print artifacts like salt-and-pepper noise and slight registration misalignment, tactile matte finish.
background_prompt: A textured vintage paper background featuring a coarse woodblock landscape pattern, purely graphic environment with no central subject, rendered in a limited palette of {{primary_color}} and {{accent_color}} ink on textured stock, abstract foliage and terrain suggested by rough stippled hatching and solid ink blocks, flat perspective typical of 1950s matchbox art, high noise and paper grain visible throughout, ink starvation textures in solid areas, negative space carving defines the forms against the paper tone, full bleed texture.
prompt_removebg: Vintage matchbox label illustration style, mid-century commercial woodblock print aesthetic, Risograph duotone technique, the {{subject}} is rendered as a bold graphic form, heavy ink saturation with visible grain texture showing through, rendering is flat and iconographic with no gradients or smooth shading, depth is achieved purely through coarse stippling and density of ink dots, the {{subject}} is depicted primarily in blocks of {{primary_color}} ink where internal details like facial features and clothing folds are carved out in negative space revealing the underlying {{background_color}} tone, secondary elements are printed in {{accent_color}} ink creating a vibrating visual contrast, composited on a clean {{background_color}} surface, the subject's silhouette is defined by rough stamp-like edges that interact naturally with the {{background_color}} backdrop, lighting is non-directional and purely graphic with highlights represented by total absence of ink (showing {{background_color}}), shadows are solid blocks of {{primary_color}}, texture is tactile and rough, edges are slightly irregular and organic mimicking ink bleed and stamp pressure variations calibrated for {{background_color}} contrast, the visual language borrows from 1950s folk ephemera and cheap offset lithography, atmospheric perspective is flattened into two distinct color layers, strict color separation with no blending between {{primary_color}} and {{accent_color}}, high-contrast graphic impact, {{mood}}, distinct retro print artifacts like salt-and-pepper noise and slight registration misalignment, tactile matte finish.
background_prompt_removebg: A textured vintage paper background featuring a coarse woodblock landscape pattern, purely graphic environment with no central subject, rendered in a limited palette of {{primary_color}} and {{accent_color}} ink, abstract foliage and terrain suggested by rough stippled hatching and solid ink blocks, flat perspective typical of 1950s matchbox art, high noise and paper grain visible throughout, ink starvation textures in solid areas, negative space carving defines the forms against the {{background_color}} tone, a decorative ornamental frame of {{accent_color}} geometric patterns borders the scene creating a vintage label effect, the entire texture fades atmospherically into the {{background_color}} surface at the outer edges.
